meanings.definition: To make a hole or opening in (something) and insert an eyelet.
meanings.sent1: She eyeleted the fabric to attach the lace.
meanings.sent2: The tailor eyeleted the leather to add decorative rivets.
meanings.sent3: He eyeleted the paper with precision, turning it into a unique bookmark.
meanings.sent4: The chef eyeleted the dough, creating a perfect hole for the filling.
meanings.sent5: The artist eyeleted the canvas, preparing it for a creative project.

meanings.sent1: The curtain was eyeleted, allowing easy hanging on the rod.
meanings.sent2: Her shoes were eyeleted, giving them a stylish and breathable design.
meanings.sent3: The tent was eyeleted, making it sturdy and ready for camping adventures.
meanings.sent4: The banner was eyeleted, fluttering in the wind with its metal rings.
meanings.sent5: The tarp was eyeleted, securing it firmly in place during the storm.

meanings.sent1: He eyeleted the banner to the pole for the event.
meanings.sent2: She eyeleted the belt to keep her pants up.
meanings.sent3: The shoemaker eyeleted the straps, ensuring a snug fit.
meanings.sent4: The gardener eyeleted the net to protect the plants from birds.
meanings.sent5: The tailor eyeleted the dress, adding a touch of elegance to the design.
